content.purpose: The Manager II, Internal Controls job owns the development and execution of the organization's financial control framework strategy, internal control policies, processes and tools for financial reporting risk management in support of efficient operations, reliable financial reporting and compliance with laws, regulations and corporate policies. This job directs the department responsible for establishing and implementing global financial control framework and serving as management’s liaison between the third line of defense and the first line of defense. The job also provides strategic direction on the enhancement of centralized monitoring of financial reporting risk management process effectiveness through various forms of evaluation and testing.
content.key_account:
• Control Framework Design: Owns the establishment and execution of the organization's financial control framework, including global accounting standards and policies, and drives vision and actions for technology enablement of financial control processes.
  • Financial Planning & Analysis: Leads and guides the financial planning and analysis evaluation processes, including budgeting, forecasting, and financial modeling to support strategic decision making by providing insights based on financial performance and indicators.
  • Planning & Reporting Solution Efficiency: Leads the collaboration with various internal stakeholders to drive efficiency of the planning and reporting solutions to ensure alignment of metrics to continuously optimize the data integrity, standardization and effectiveness of financial information.
  • Collaboration: Monitors the organization's control metrics, consults key stakeholders on highly complex accounting issues, and serves as the primary contact for controls and technical accounting processes, issue resolution and initiatives.
  • Transformation Initiatives: Champions financial internal controls transformation initiatives globally to drive transparency and simplification of top to bottom processes, identifying global trends, synergies and opportunities and leading management reporting and planning improvement projects to support key business strategy leadership teams.
  • Continuous Improvement: Cultivates a culture of continuous improvement efforts by empowering teams to simplify and optimize processes, improve data integrity, and leverage financial and business systems and technical platforms to improve reporting, frameworks, procedures and technology.

content.purpose: The Manager II, Tax Compliance job owns the development of strategy and the execution of income tax compliance and global tax accounting, including financial statement reporting activities. This job directs and guides the department responsible for tax compliance execution, processes development and relevant planning initiatives while managing controversies and legislative and regulatory implementations.
content.key_account:
• Tax Filing Compliance: Leads the execution of timely and accurate fulfillment of the company’s income tax filing obligations and oversees tax compliance tasks, preparation of tax returns, tax forms and related documents to ensure key filing positions are supported by appropriate documentation while controlling tax compliance activities.
  • Financial Statement Reporting: Directs the development and implementation of complete and accurate financial statement reporting of tax matters under U.S. GAAP and coaches the team's analyses on income tax compliance and accounting.
  • Stakeholder Communication: Establishes relationships with key partners, both internal and external, to direct effective communications on tax accounting issues.
  • Cross-Functional Collaboration: Provides advice to tax and non-tax teams to ensure they understand the impact of tax accounting on their business objectives.
  • Strategic Planning and Legislative Partnership: Participates in strategic planning initiatives, oversees and reviews tax compliance analysis and partners with other tax teams on legislative and regulatory developments.
  • Operational Excellence: Directs operational excellence and continuous improvement activities in tax accounting and compliance and oversees tax audits effectiveness.
  • Tax Compliance Process Development and Improvement: Directs the development and implementation of policies and tax compliance processes, including approval of processes and data requirements for tax, financial, compliance-related systems.
  • Team Management: Manages team members to achieve the organization’s goals, by ensuring productivity, communicating performance expectations, creating goal alignment, giving and seeking feedback, providing coaching, measuring progress and holding people accountable, supporting employee development, recognizing achievement and lessons learned, and developing enabling conditions for talent to thrive in an inclusive team culture.

This  job provides strategic leadership to the  department responsible for the design and  execution of standard related tax control  framework templates, adapted to reflect relative  tax risks in each country, the development and  deployment of compliance programs, reporting  and audit, and governance of the migration and  operation of tax compliance activities.

  • Control Framework Deployment and Improvement: Leads the team to identify and deploy the target architecture: to support the specific frameworks for each country aligned with strategic goals and objectives.
  • Tax Operation Strategy: Partners collaboratively to develop and implement a comprehensive program to: segment, prioritize, and implement all aspects of global tax compliance across all tax types.
  • Data Analytics Deployment: Directs the design and deployment of efficient data analytics to support both the: control framework and tax compliance, reporting and audit operations.
  • Tax Process Design: Provides guidance to ensure the design of effective tax processes to meet global: compliance, reporting and legal requirements for audit, including the identification and solution of central control gaps.

content.purpose: The Manager II, Trade Compliance Operations job owns the: execution of the most complex global trade compliance  operations activities and trade compliance projects. This job  provides overall operational direction to the department  responsible for the development and optimization of global trade  and compliance transactions, ensures compliance, and provides  strategic guidance to drive continuous improvement in support  of the business strategy and objectives.
content.key_account:

  • Transaction Auditing: Oversees the resolution of audits and assessments of trade transactions: to ensure compliance with import/export regulations, customs requirements, and trade agreements.
  • Documentation Review: Provides strategic direction to ensure trade documents and other: cross-border documents are in compliance with legal and fiscal requirements and guidelines.
  • Relationship Management: Fosters strategic relationships with key internal and external: stakeholders and partners to optimize the development of cross-border trade solutions.
  • Metrics Analysis: Defines key performance indicators and reviews most complex analyses for: compliance operations in the designated location to identify trends and areas for improvement.
  • Continuous Improvement: Owns the execution of functional strategy for internal global trade: and compliance projects.

This job leads the development and optimization of  customs solutions and processes, ensures adherence to import  and export customs regulations, resolves legal disputes and  audits, and provides expert advice and strategic guidance on  relevant trade matters. This job provides overall operational  direction to the department responsible for developing customs  compliance policies and managing customs issues and  regulations.
content.key_account:
• Policy and Procedure Development: Oversees the development of customs solutions,: planning, compliance policies, and procedures to ensure adherence to applicable laws and regulations.
  • Expert Advising: Advises senior management and business leaders to ensure compliance with: customs regulations and trade policies to mitigate impacts to the organization, and provides final recommendations on local and regional technical and regulatory interpretations including classifications, country of origin determinations, and regulated product flows.
  • Customs Strategies: Partners with global and regional trade compliance stakeholders, tax: managers, and other business leaders to develop, implement, and optimize global customs strategies.
  • Audits and Investigations: Oversees the resolution of customs-related issues, including: customs audits, investigations, and disputes.
  • Metrics Analysis: Reviews analyses of customs compliance metrics to identify trends and: areas for improvement.
  • Relationship Management: Fosters relationships with legal counsel and customs authorities to: stay informed of regulatory updates and best practices and build a reputation for adherence to import and export customs regulations.

  • Compliance Operations & Sensitized Data Strategy: Designs and directs the implementation of: regional trade compliance operations, sensitized data management systems, and processes, harmonizing to a scalable framework of standards to secure and facilitate global trade and address new and emerging developments in the international supply chain.

This job  manages the department responsible for supporting, developing, and  implementing the core technology platforms utilized by treasury, such as  the global treasury management system. This job plays a key role in  driving innovations in organizational technology to optimize treasury  business activities and improve treasury's global operating model.

  • Business Process Implementation: Designs and updates business processes that align: with treasury’s global operating model and governance structures, ensuring changes to core technology are implemented effectively and coordinated end-to-end with all stakeholders across all technology platforms.

content.purpose: The Manager II, Cash Management & Treasury Operations job: owns the execution of cash management and treasury  operations for the assigned region. This job manages the  department responsible for optimizing cash flow, mitigating  financial risks, and supporting the organization's financial  objectives. This job advises businesses and corporate  technology programs on cash management and financial  product operations to align the organization under one global  operating model.
content.key_account:
• Cash & Liquidity Management Strategy: Leads the development and: implementation of cash and liquidity management strategy in the assigned region, which includes activities such as optimizing cash pooling structures to meet local cash needs and concentrating cash with global banking partners.
  • Treasury Operations Strategy: Leads the development and implementation of: treasury operations strategy in the assigned region, which includes activities such as refining processes and policies related to financial derivatives compliance, regulatory reporting, financial controls, and the global operating model.
  • Opportunity Implementation: Oversees the implementation of new business: opportunities and organizational changes to grow the treasury market's revenue.
  • Global Operating Model: Facilitates the treasury’s global operating model in the: designated region, ensuring that processes are designed and executed consistently across stakeholder groups and technology platforms.

content.purpose: The Manager II, Capital Markets & Trading job owns the execution of: strategic objectives for the designated region's funding and foreign  exchange treasury center service desk to ensure that the organization  has access to the necessary funds, manage currency risks, optimize  costs, and comply with regulatory requirements. This job provides  strategic leadership to the department responsible for developing and  executing on the strategy for the organization's and its businesses'  funding and foreign exchange needs in the region, including hedging  and advisory on currency and interest rates.
content.key_account:
• Service Desk Leadership: Develops and leads the funding and foreign exchange service: desk structures for the designated region, with a focus on short-term strategic funding and foreign exchange execution processes and procedures for all countries involved in the region.
  • Debt Book & Fixed Float Mix: Establishes the strategy to govern the long-term debt book: and the fixed float mix, as well as net investment hedging book for the organization to optimize the organization's financial structure, minimize risk, and enhance financial performance.
  • Profit & Loss Maintenance: Reviews treasury profit and loss statements and the treasury: funding book to ensure up-to-date information for the designated regions is reflected.
  • Risk Management: Manages the risk taking book for designated regions, which includes: oversight of risk positions in foreign exchange and interest rate markets.
  • Credit Strategy: Develops the organization's credit strategy to ensure the most efficient: and effective utilization of global bank credit lines allocated to the region.

content.purpose: The Manager II, Treasury Advisory job owns the execution of the: organization's treasury strategy, including providing strategic  leadership on treasury advisory services to assigned organizational  divisions to continuously improve the organization's treasury  advisory practices, strategic projects, and overall financial well being. This job manages the department responsible for providing  treasury advisory services including analyzing financial data,  identifying risks, and developing strategies to mitigate risk.
content.key_account:
• Treasury Strategy Development: Oversees the implementation of the organization's treasury: strategy, and collaborates on the development of new strategies to improve the organization's treasury advisory practices, strategic projects, and overall financial well-being.
  • Risk Management: Applies understanding of treasury practices and procedures to ensure risk: management and treasury advisory expertise is provided to the organization related to acquisitions, disposals, joint ventures, subsidiary corporate structure, subsidiary capital structure, foreign exchange exposure, local treasury issues, and credit capacity and capital structure alternatives.
  • Relationship Management: Fosters critical corporate banking relationships with major banks in: the region and ensures consistent relationships and disclosure approaches to financial counterparties and other debt investors.
  • Funding Solution Development: Oversees the resolution of structural funding issues between: relevant parties of significant treasury transactions and leads funding solutions where applicable, ensuring identification and management of related tax, legal and regulatory issues.
  • Advising: Governs activities and oversees treasury advisory projects related to mergers,: acquisitions, divestitures, and joint ventures, including due diligence, financing, structuring, planning, and integration.
  • Process Review: Evaluates treasury operations for the defined organizational divisions to: ensure they are efficient, well-controlled, and aligned with business objectives, and oversees the development of new processes and guidelines when improvements are needed.
  • Team Management: Manages team members to achieve the organization’s goals, by ensuring: productivity, communicating performance expectations, creating goal alignment, giving and seeking feedback, providing coaching, measuring progress and holding people accountable, supporting employee development, recognizing achievement and lessons learned, and developing enabling conditions for talent to thrive in an inclusive team culture.

content.purpose: The Senior Advisor, Commercial Finance job guides: the development of financial strategy, setting clear,  financially focused targets for the organization, and  ensuring effective deployment of capital. As a  recognized subject matter expert internally and  externally in commercial finance and financial  planning and analysis, this job is a strategic thought  leader for finance and cross functional leadership,  providing necessary financial rigor and analytics and  ensuring the achievement of financial results and  value creation for the organization.
content.key_account:
• Business/Function Financial Planning: Guides the coordination and linking of all planning and forecasting: processes for global or regional highly complex businesses, including customer profitability, or enterprise demand drivers for functions, by applying understanding of key drivers of results and related sensitivities.
  • Drives Business Performance: Establishes and analyzes performance metrics to direct strategy execution,: utilizing technology to drive aligned performance management of the business, including the knowledge and measurement of end to end processes and the impact to the business.
  • Modeling & Analytics: Reviews and develops advanced modelling and benchmarking to bring new: perspectives to the business, and develops and delivers presentations to communicate insights, including defending positions on controversial topics, and adapting style to continuously seek win-win solutions.
  • Forecasting: Reviews and develops necessary financial projections and approves the final financial forecast: and model for the business to support new product development projects.
  • Collaboration: Partners with finance and business functional stakeholders to play an active role in: influencing others and enhancing connectivity and effective communication.
  • Capital Project Investment Portfolio Management: Guides the development, management and execution of: the capital investment portfolio across the assigned business to achieve strategic goals of the business and organizational goals, ensuring governance of portfolio and program practices.
  • Capital Project Investment Portfolio Management Reporting & Analysis: Reviews the status of the portfolio: performance metrics and goals, overall business impact of projects within the portfolio and programs, identifies variances from plans, and partners with business leaders to develop corrective actions.
  • Continuous Improvement: Reviews and interprets research to identify key issues and drive continuous: improvement, and reviews business impacts, including financial and nonfinancial impacts, to influence optimization activities and recommend process changes.

Title: Senior Advisor, Corporate Financial Planning & Analysis (CF)

content.purpose: The Senior Advisor, Corporate FP&A job provides expert: consultative guidance in providing financial planning  support and insights for the organization's businesses and  leadership. As a recognized subject matter expert in  financial planning and analysis both internally and  externally, this job guides the planning consolidation  activities, leveraging financial planning applications, and  developing analysis and presentation of planning materials  for the executive team business review and board of  directors. This job influences long range planning and  strategy initiatives, provides recommendation on allocation  of resources across the organization, and engages cross  functional teams to drive effective planning activities.
content.key_account:
• Financial Planning & Analysis: Counsels stakeholders and teams to drive value within the: organization, translating insights into business performance against competitor and industry trends to help leadership focus on the most critical risks and opportunities, while partnering with businesses and functions.
  • Reporting, Planning & Forecasting Processes: Provides expert consultative guidance on: reporting, planning and forecasting processes and enhances scenario strategic planning analysis.
  • Quarterly Planning & Forecasting: Partners with the chief financial officer, or enterprise finance: director, and all enterprise finance directors to review quarterly and annual planning and forecasting materials.
  • Sets Performance Metrics: Guides the establishment of performance metrics driven by historical: analysis and external benchmarking to drive strategy execution and employs advanced modeling skills to bring new perspectives to the business.
  • Drives Improvement: Influences and recommends opportunities to improve planning processes: with technology and incorporates feedback to refine processes and leadership materials.
  • Market Perspective: Provides expert consultation and serves as a strategic partner in the field: using additional research and interpretation to identify key issues or problems and recommend solutions.

content.purpose: The Senior Advisor, Tax job provides expert: consultative guidance to tax research, analysis,  and compliance activities. As a recognized  subject matter expert in tax internally and  externally, this job guides tax compliance  process development and improvement, in  addition to developing tax solutions and advice  and managing audit responses and strategy.
content.key_account:
• Tax Compliance Activity Oversight: Leads the execution of strategic processes related to statutory and/or U.S. GAAP: accounting for tax related items and provides guidance and oversight for the preparation of tax returns, tax forms and related documents associated with tax compliance, including provisions, computations, estimates, and extensions.
  • Tax Compliance and Inquiry Responses: Provides expert consultative guidance to the organization's subsidiaries, joint: ventures, business staff and tax department leadership on unique and ambiguous tax transactions and issues.
  • Tax Compliance Process Development: Develops and implements global policies and specific tax compliance processes,: leads tax compliance projects, and advises on the development of processes and data requirements for tax/financial/compliance systems.
  • Tax Compliance Process Improvement: Provide expert consultative guidance to resolve significant issues with business: compliance processes by analyzing compliance processes and/or the applications used in these processes to identify and resolve tax and work process issues in practice, minimizing tax risk and optimizing tax filing positions for the organization.
  • Developing Tax Solutions: Develops strategic technical tax planning solutions to optimize the organization's tax liabilities and: risks across enterprises and geographies, and guides the implementation and process-improvement initiatives, either capturing significant tax benefits or mitigating significant tax risk.
  • Providing Tax Counsel: Identifies training opportunities and needs and develops trainings for the organization's business, and: partners with and provides advice for senior leaders, serving as source of tax information through meetings and training sessions.
  • Tax Research, Analysis & Strategic Planning: Supports strategic tax objective planning, and conducts and reviews strategic: tax-related research and analysis for the purpose of completing tax compliance responsibilities.
  • Audit Strategy: Develops and oversees audit defense strategies and best practices for audits by identifying areas of audit risk: and coordinating efforts to remediate compliance deficiencies and audit planning.
  • Conducting Audits: Manages relationships with and responds to requests from external revenue bodies and taxing authorities,: develops responses and responds to unique audits and information requests from external taxing authorities, and generates and compiles evidence for senior team members to verify in response to high risk audits and information requests from external tax authorities, including providing IRS with research and rationale for tax structure.

content.purpose: The Senior Advisor, Tax Compliance job: provides expert consultative guidance for the  development of strategy and execution of  income tax compliance and global tax  accounting, including financial statement  reporting activities. As a recognized subject  matter expert in tax compliance internally and  externally, this job guides and influences tax  compliance execution, processes development  and relevant planning initiatives while handling  controversies and legislative and regulatory  implementations.
content.key_account:
• Tax Filing Compliance: Provides guidance and oversight on the execution of timely and accurate fulfillment of the: company’s income tax filing obligations, including tax compliance tasks, tax returns, tax forms and related documents to ensure key filing positions are supported by appropriate documentation.
  • Financial Statement Reporting: Provides expert consultative guidance on financial statement reporting of tax matters: under U.S. GAAP and analysis on income tax compliance and accounting.
  • Stakeholder Communication: Fosters relationships with key partners, both internal and external, to guide effective: communications on tax accounting issues.
  • Cross-Functional Collaboration: Provides advice and guidance to tax and non-tax teams to ensure they understand: the impact of tax accounting on their business objectives.
  • Strategic Planning and Legislative Partnership: Develops strategic planning initiatives, guides tax compliance: analysis and partners with other tax teams on legislative and regulatory developments.
  • Operational Excellence: Leads operational excellence and continuous improvement activities in tax accounting and: compliance and oversees tax audits effectiveness.
  • Tax Compliance Process Development and Improvement: Provides expert consultative guidance to resolve: significant issues with business compliance processes and develops global policies and specific processes, leads tax compliance projects, and advises on the development of processes and data requirements for tax, financial, compliance-related systems.

content.purpose: The Senior Advisor, Trade Compliance job provides expert: consultative guidance to the establishment and implementation  of comprehensive internal import and export controls and  governance activities to ensure compliance with all trade-related  regulations. As a recognized subject matter expert both  internally and externally, this job guides process development  and improvement to ensure international business activities are  compliant with relevant regulatory requirements and leads the  execution of strategic audits and the implementation of training  programs to drive the effectiveness of internal trade controls.
content.key_account:
• Policy and Procedure Development: Leads the execution of global trade compliance programs,: policies and procedures, applying knowledge of relevant customs and trade-related laws, regulations, practices and procedures to align with applicable laws and regulations.
  • Business Process Improvement: Provides expert consultative guidance for continuous improvement: across business compliance processes at both regional and global levels, and supports strategic direction for customs related activities across the organization, including subsidiaries, joint ventures, and business units.
  • Solution Development: Develops strategic solutions for the most complex and technical customs: planning optimization in order to capture significant customs benefits and mitigate risks globally by driving strategic planning and modeling of trading, trade flow and risk management activity.
  • Expert Advising: Advises and influences senior management and business leaders to provide: information and guidance on customs aspects of key business plans and strategy.
  • Audit Oversight: Manages high risk audits and responds to information requests from external: customs authorities, and provides consultative guidance for audit defense strategies and best practices by identifying potential compliance risks and developing solutions to mitigate these risks.
  • Relationship Management: Fosters relationships with appropriate government agencies to stay: updated of regulatory changes and leads improvement execution.
  • Metrics Analysis: Apply master knowledge to develop and support the implementation of trade: compliance metrics to identify trends and areas for improvement.
  • Compliance Training: Identifies and develops strategic training opportunities, and leads the design of: training programs aimed at educating employees on trade compliance requirements and best practices.

content.purpose: The Senior Advisor, Capital Markets & Trading job provides: strategic thought leadership through comprehensive data-driven  analysis of economic conditions, industry trends and competitive  landscape. As a recognized subject matter expert internally and  externally, this job provides consultative guidance to support  trading and commercial activities, focusing on customers and  sales teams while contributing to generate and activate compelling  economic insights to help businesses achieve the strategic  objectives. This job influences business decisions for strategic  planning by analyzing markets, competition and broader economic  dynamics.
content.key_account:
• Economic Monitoring: Tracks and analyzes current economic conditions and developments: affecting the industry, markets, and business to provide early indication reports on potential deviations from baseline economic outlooks, including conducting forecasting work to inform treasury trading decisions and optimize financial strategies.
  • Strategic Data Analysis: Leads efforts to assemble, prioritize, synthesize, and curate: diverse data sources to develop and implement highly specialized analysis and advanced analytics to identify and interpret meaningful trends or patterns.
  • Consultative Guidance: Oversees all aspects of econometric models and conducts: comprehensive economic studies impacting the industry and customers, providing expert consultative guidance.
  • Actionable Insights: Applies mastery knowledge and available data to deliver actionable: insights for short and long-term strategies on pricing, wages, trading and risk management.
  • Industry Expertise: Guides and develops expert thought leadership in the field, conducts: and reviews additional research and interpretation to identify trends, and champions efforts to use standard methodologies to drive improvements.
  • Relationship Management: Partners collaboratively with leadership and customers to: understand business needs, deliver presentations and detailed write-ups to efficiently communicate insights and strategies.

content.purpose: The Senior Advisor, Treasury Advisory job guides unique and: ambiguous treasury financial advisory services for defined  organizational divisions and offers strategic analytical support to  the leadership team. As a recognized subject matter expert in  treasury advisory internally and externally, this job develops new  principles, theories, concepts, techniques, industry practices, and  standards to continuously improve the organization's treasury  advisory practices, strategic projects, and overall financial well being.
content.key_account:
• Financial Modeling: Drives innovation in financial analysis and oversees financial modeling: to support decision-making on the most complex, unique, and ambiguous issues.
  • Policy Compliance: Provides expert consultative guidance on the design of financial policies: and procedures within the organization and provides advisory services to ensure compliance with organizational policies.
  • Corporate Financial Structure: Ascertains and approves subsidiary and country capital: structure, dividend policy and corporate structure decisions of legal entities in the assigned regions.
  • Advising: Oversees all aspects of treasury advisory consultation related to mergers,: acquisitions, divestitures, and joint ventures, including due diligence, financing, structuring, planning, and integration.
  • Risk Management: Leads advisory to businesses to identify opportunities and risks, help: minimize and manage financial risks, including foreign exchange risk management, country risk and joint venture financing policy.
  • Banking Relationships: Maintains proactive, personable, and consistent dialogue with local,: regional, and global banks in the defined regions to ensure adequate credit capacity, optimal risk management, and sharing of best practices.
  • Industry Expertise: Guides and develops expert thought leadership in the treasury advisory: field, conducts and reviews additional research and interpretation to identify key trends, and champions efforts to utilize industry benchmarks and best practices to drive risk management and cost analysis improvements and effectiveness.

content.purpose: The Senior Advisor, Treasury Leadership job provides strategic thought: leadership on insurance and treasury financial analytics services for the  domain leadership team. As a recognized subject matter expert internally  and externally, this job provides consultative guidance for complex  financial and risk analysis, including developing comprehensive analysis  of risk and cost drivers and conducting robust performance  measurements and insights for the function. This job leads changes to  ensure information needed for consolidated global analysis and risk  management metrics is available, accurate and efficiently gathered, while  leading analysis and publications for senior management, communicating  insights and driving action to develop a culture of appreciation for metrics  and analysis within the domain.
content.key_account:
• Strategy and Planning: Advise and provide complex analysis for how the area is performing,: underperforming over time, or challenging strategic decisions based on insights garnered through analysis.
  • Hazard Risk Management Metrics Development: Lead the development of regular metrics: for hazard risk management to assess risk management performance and trends over time and apply industry benchmarks and methodologies to drive improvements and effectiveness.
  • Corporate Financial Analysis and Stakeholder Engagement: Drives corporate level financial: analysis to support decision making and champion relationships with other key partners where hazard exposures can be mitigated in ways beyond the purchase of insurance.
  • Actuarial Insights and Risk Estimation: Leads the process for procuring and deriving: insights from actuarial studies, in coordination with the commercial team, to estimate retained risk and total cost for certain hazard categories and partners with key teams to resolve accounting requirements for retained loss and balance sheet substantiation.
  • Expense and Risk Analysis: Drives coordination across functions and other corporate: activities to present a cohesive analysis of expenses and risks, developing one version of the truth.
  • Capital Requirements and Value Optimization: Understands capital requirements for the: organization´s captive insurance company and drives analysis and insights to identify further opportunities to capture value through the captive and to ensure compliance given the risks retained in that entity.
  • Data-Driven Planning and Forecasting: Leverages technology and internal and external: data to plan and forecast insurance costs and loss recoveries, ensuring alignment with executives, functions and business needs to develop effective and robust processes and models.
